title: How the internet was born in a tiny basement 50 years ago today
text:
Today, in a building set a block back from the Charles River in Boston, three elderly men will gather to reminisce about an astonishing achievement now 50 years old.

The trio’s names are not as famous as those of Armstrong and Aldrin or even Michael Collins, the oft-forgotten third man on the Apollo 11 mission. But Robert Kahn, Leonard Kleinrock and Vint Cerf arguably had a far more dramatic impact. For their work established the building blocks of our networked world.

That is a world, in which Facebook is fined $5bn for misusing data, but where the UK government is criticised for not using data well enough to understand its citizens. Where Peter Thiel, the Trump advisor and founder of "spooky"...
description: Today, in a building set a block back from the Charles River in Boston, three elderly men will gather to reminisce about an astonishing achievement now 50 years old.
